fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Customer is a Jira Adminstrator and he is looking for an option where a normal user who is assigned a role as Project Administrator/Manager should be able to manage the Project schemes. Because due to non availability of this functionality customer as Jira Administrator is getting multiple requests for changes.

h3. Suggested Solution
Create customised permission schemes and use it for the respective projects as per requirement. So Jira Admin doesn't have to  
h3. Workaround 
Currently this functionality is not available and workaround to achieve this as of now.
fields.summary: Project Administrator/Manager should be able to manage/edit Project Schemes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The error below is observed in the atlassian-jira.log which caused the customer to be concerned.
{noformat}
2021-12-28 21:50:04,596+0000 pool-60-thread-1 WARN      [c.a.jira.plugin.JiraPluginManager] Attempted to unregister components for non existing plugin 'com.atlassian.ams.shipit.tomcat-filter'
{noformat}

The component {{'com.atlassian.ams.shipit.tomcat-filter'}} appears to be part of the Thready app (available to Jira 8.14 and earlier versions) which is now part of the Support Tools Plugin.  Even though the Thready stand alone plugin is no longer present in the Jira instance as far as I can see, the log still throw this error which confuses the customer.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Stand up a standard Jira software instance v8.20 (what I tested with)
 # Search the atlassian-jira.log for the string "Attempted to unregister components for non existing plugin 'com.atlassian.ams.shipit.tomcat-filter'"

h3. Expected Results

The expected result is that this string would not be available in the log because the Thready application is not installed.

h3. Actual Results
When Thready app is not installed in the Jira instance, the log entry is present. 

h3. Workaround
This does not appear to cause any problem or interfere with any features or functionalities. 
This can be safely ignored.
fields.summary: Attempted to unregister components for non existing plugin 'com.atlassian.ams.shipit.tomcat-filter'

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A customer did some tests with cypress and when running searches on the Jira server in parallel ended up getting an exception error.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Search for retrieve all projectIds, and then removes project. The first thread still keeps projectId that was already removed by the second one and when it tries to get project object it gets null

h3. Expected Results

Search results
h3. Actual Results

com.atlassian.jira.util.dbc.Assertions$NullArgumentException
h3. Workaround


Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Jira Search Throwing an Exception to the End User.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The UMASK of 0027 is set when Jira is starting, so the files created by Jira should respect it. 
{code:java}
-Dorg.apache.catalina.security.SecurityListener.UMASK=0027 
{code}
However, the avatar files created for notification show permission of 600, which do not respect the UMASK of 0027.

This problem did not happen in 8.13, so it is likely a {*}regression since 8.16{*}.

 

Comments added 2021-12-28:
It does not happen to all attachment files, only happened to system default avatars(SVG), like below. Seems the above avatars is using for notification, but not sure it is related to notification directly.
{code:java}
-rw------- 1 jira jira  708 Dec 28 00:55 medium_Avatar-default.png
{code}
Others:
It is pointed that the above avatars are generated by [com.atlassian.dc.filestore.* , which is using by Java NIO.
{code:java}
com.atlassian.dc.filestore.*
<install_directory>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/filestore-api-0.3.0.jar
<install_directory>/atlassian-jira/WEB-INF/lib/filestore-filesystem-0.3.0.jar
{code}
In the file writing process of the above library, it seems that a temp file is created first, and is moved to the official file name in Files.createTempFile .
The process didn't seem to specify permissions in the FileAttribute argument.
[https://docs.oracle.com/javase/jp/11/docs/api/java.base/java/nio/file/Files.html#createTempFile(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.nio.file.attribute.FileAttribute...\|https://docs.oracle.com/javase/jp/11/docs/api/java.base/java/nio/file/Files.html#createTempFile(java.lang.String,java.lang.String,java.nio.file.attribute.FileAttribute...])

In that case, in Files.createTempFile, unless you specify the permission in the argument of FileAttribute
As shown below, the default authority has priority (default is 0600), so this problem is caused
[https://github.com/AdoptOpenJDK/openjdk-jdk11/blob/master/src/java.base/share/classes/java/nio/file/TempFileHelper.java#L67]

In other words, maybe this problem cannot be resolved, unless correction is applied in the above library, and new version of the library comes to Jira.

 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Login as Jira administrator
 # Create a new user, and set the user an avatar.
 #  Login as new user, and create an issue, and assign it to the administrator.
 # A mail notification will be sent from new user to administrator.
 # Meanwhile, avatar file will be generated in [/var/atlassian/application-data/jira/data/avatars]

h3. Expected Results

Avatar files respect the UMASK of 0027, and will have permission of 640.
h3. Actual Results

Avatar files were created with the permission of 600.
h3. Workaround

Run chmod command before running a backup.
fields.summary: Avatars created for notification do not respect UMASK

fields.description:

if we run these calls these will run into errors.

the actual format should be like below:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

In the issue details page right-side panel, there's a _View on Board_ link which serves as a quick way for you to see the issue on the board. However, it doesn't work if there are more issues on the board which doesn't fit in a screen as a whole. However, JIRA should be smart enough to locate the highlighted issue, regardless of its position on the board.

*PS:* This was working in the Jira Versions 7. x.x however it is broken since Jira Version 8. x.x. We notice an FR -JSWSERVER-20045 raised to get the feature but it has worked on v 7. x.x but not on later versions.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access Jira software *v 8.20.1* application.
 # Ensure that the Issues on the Active Sprint have more in number which doesn't fit in a single screen.
 # Go to the Issue view page of any Issue located at the bottom of the Active Sprint Board.
 # Click on "View on Board" from the right-side panel of the Issue view page.
 # Jira redirects us to the Sprint Board but does not locate the issue card on the board.

h3. Expected Results

JIRA should be smart enough to locate the highlighted issue, regardless of its position on the board.
h3. Actual Results

Jira is not able to locate the issue on the Board.
h3. Workaround

Scroll down the bar to locate the issue highlighted manually.
fields.summary: Click on "View on Board" link is not scrolling down to the highlighted issue on the Board containing more issues

Please fix.

 

Thank you very much!
fields.summary: Issue when mentioning in a comment

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to rename Screen tab from  *Administration - Issues - Screens.*
The issue is intermittent and more evident if we set the language to Russian, German, etc.
Issue reported while using Chrome  (Version 96.0.4664.110) and Edge browser.
For more clarity, please refer to the video recording attached.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Access any Jira software {*}v 8.20.{*}* application.
 # Go to *Administrations (Settings) > Issues > Screens*
 # Add a new Screen or Edit any existing screens
 # In Configure screen page, create a Field tab
 # Try to change the Field tab name by editing the field
 # Click on "{*}Save{*}"
 # For example: If the field tab name is "First Tab", try to change it to "Second Tab"
!Screenshot 2021-12-23 at 6.29.09 PM.png!

h3. Expected Results

The Field tab name will be updated to the desired name.
h3. Actual Results

Jira GUI is not giving any response when we click on the "Save" button.
h3. Workaround

Use Firefox browser. 
Tested Version 94.0.2

fields.description:
To facilitate the gathering of information around the Jira indexes (especially in cases where it is not easy/possible to access each node directly), it would be helpful to have a version of '[GET /rest/api/2/index/summary|https://docs.atlassian.com/software/jira/docs/api/REST/8.20.0/#index/summary-getIndexSummary]' that brings information from all nodes at once.
h4. Workaround

Utilize the Index Summary script available at (it may not be helpful on all scenarios) - [Index Replication Jira Data Center Troubleshooting|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/index-replication-jira-data-center-troubleshooting-966676040.html]
fields.summary: Create a REST endpoint that returns the results the index summary for all nodes in the cluster

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
At this moment, autocomplete will try to match the string typed by a user with the beginning of a word. 

For example:
* There are words: *internalcomment* and *internal comment*
* If user types *internal*, it will return both  *internalcomment* and *internal comment*
* If user types *comment*, it will only return *internal comment*

In some cases, customers will use " - ", for example *internal-comment*. With this example, typing *comment* will not return this *internal-comment*

h4. Suggestion Solution
It'll be great to have an option on how autocomplete should suggest. Instead of just matching the beginning of the word, we should have an option that allows autocomplete to match the word containing the string typed by users. 

So for example:
* There are words: *internalcomment*, *internal-comment* and *internal comment*
* If a user types *comment*, it should return all of them (*internalcomment*, *internal-comment* and *internal comment*)
fields.summary: Autocomplete should match word that contains the string typed by user

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If an admin accidently misses a / and provides a relative path instead of an absolute one, unexpected behavior can occur such as incorrect shared home paths ( plugin location )
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# set a relative path in cluster.properties such as var/atlassian/shared-home
 # start Jira and note the location of shared home in system info: /opt/atlassian/jira/bin/var/atlassian/shared-home

h3. Expected Results
Ideally Jira would detect the use of a relative path and warn the admin about the potential consequences

h3. Actual Results
Jira creates a new path under the installation directory and starts without expected plugins / apps

h3. Workaround
Double check path information in system info and use absolute paths
fields.summary: Providing relative paths in file location configurations can cause unexpected behavior
Can't post files to deploments url

fields.description:
h3. Problem
During startup, Jira runs a startup index recovery.
When a manual index snapshot recovery is triggered, the two index recovery operations are allowed to run concurrently. This should not be the case as described in a previous bug ticket [JRASERVER-42234: Prevent concurrent index recovery operations|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-42234].

h3. Environment
8.13.10

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Restart Jira.
# Shortly after starting Jira, trigger a manual index snapshot recovery.

h3. Expected Results
The startup index recovery should not run side by side with the manual index snapshot recovery.

h3. Actual Results
{{start-index-recovery}} was still running while manual index snapshot recovery was triggered from {{/secure/admin/IndexRecover.jspa}}

h3. Workaround
When the {{/secure/admin/IndexRecover.jspa [c.a.j.w.a.admin.index.IndexAdminImpl] Index Recovery finished}} shows up in the logs, this means that index is recovered. If Jira is inaccessible despite this message in the logs, restarting Jira will bring it to a usable state.

h3. Notes
fields.summary: Jira allows concurrent index recovery during start-up

fields.description:
Usernames are displayed instead of full names in the permission scheme when we add a single user by editing the permission scheme in project settings.


h3. Suggested Solution:
For all other user fields like Reporter, assignee the full names are displayed so apply the same behavior for the permission scheme too.

(on) This behavior doesn't happen for users created on 7.0 or previous versions
fields.summary: Usernames are displayed instead of full names in permission scheme

fields.description:
At the moment, Jira cannot display Epics as cards in the Scrum backlog natively.

We would like to suggest to provide an option to allow Epics to be displayed as cards in Scrum backlog.

We also need the kanban epic option for our scrum board, the panel is useless for us as we plan epics in future sprints and need normal drag and drop in the scrum backlog.

This would be a valuable addition to Jira.
fields.summary: Allow display Epics as cards in the Scrum backlog as an option (similar to Kanban)

fields.description:
I would suggest that we get a parameter to the Edit issue method (/rest/api/<version>/issue/) that allows us to create or edit an issue without adding an entry to the history of the issue.

This would be similar to the already present {{updateHistory}} parameter although this new parameter would be for the issue being edited.

The reason for this function request is that we have bots that continually updates our issues several times on a day and this creates a lot of entries in the history tab. All of these bot-entries makes it almost impossible to view the history tab because of slow loading and it's hard to spot changes done by anyone else than the bot.
fields.summary: Disable history when editing issue

fields.description:
h4. Problem Definition
While both the Java API, and REST API, allow reading issue archive status (eg, isArchived, archivedBy, archivedDate), the Atlassian Java REST API client does not. 

For more information see
https://docs.atlassian.com/jira-rest-java-client-parent/4.0.0/apidocs/com/atlassian/jira/rest/client/api/domain/Issue.html

h4. Suggested Solution
Have archived related parameters (eg, isArchived, archivedBy, archivedDate) readable by Atlassian Java REST API client.
fields.summary: Add issue archive details to com.atlassian.jira.rest.client Issue

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Attachment upload to the workflow transition screen fails if it is initiated from dashboard gadget e.g: Issue filter, Assigned to me gadgets.
The same behaviour is observed across different internet browsers (FireFox, Chrome and Safari).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a transition screen with Attachment field
 # Associate the new transition screen with a workflow transition
 # Navigate to the dashboard 
 # Attempt to transition the issue from the dashboard gadget, that will trigger the transition screen configured earlier:
 !transition.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Attachment should be uploaded accordingly.

h3. Actual Results
Attachment upload failed:
 !gadget.png|thumbnail! 

POST to AttachTemporaryFile failed with HTTP 400 in console log:
 !error.png|thumbnail! 

Nothing relate to the attachment upload failure captured in the logs.

h3. Workaround
The attachment can be successfully uploaded to the transition screen if we initiate the transition from the browse issue page.
 !issue.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Failed to upload attachment to workflow transition screen initiated from dashboard gadget

fields.description:
A bit like https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRASERVER-21201 but a more specific request:

Please make it possible to adjust the column width of fields in the Filter Result Gadget, which is used in dashboards. The width is now set on the field name, which is sometimes quite long. When the valus is only a number, such a wide column really isn't necessary. 

It seems to be a small request, that would really improve the layout and readabilty of dashboards.
fields.summary: Adjustable width column Filter result gadget

fields.description:

Steps to Reproduce * Navigate to an issue * Click "Edit" to open the Edit Issue Dialog * Open a AUI Dialog2 by running: {{AJS.dialog2(require("jquery")("
Test
")).show()}} * Close both dialogs by clicking the blanket * Click "Edit" to re-open the Edit Issue Dialog h3. Expected Results The Edit Issue Dialogs open correctly. h3. Actual Results The Edit Issue dialogs hangs and never loads. h3. Workaround Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.description:
We'd like to restrict the sharing of filters (and associated dashboards) to specific groups, in our case, high-profile ones such as *jira-users*. Or grant this sharing permission to a specific set of users only.

In our example, new team members, given application access by these groups, are able to view the data shared out by the filters, dashboards, and agile boards.

fields.description:
When an external participant is added to a ticket, the notifications sent to this new participant will not have the entire history of the ticket. Which can cause confusion when joining a ticket.

Make sure to add the whole history of notifications when a newcomer is added to the ticket and receives the first notification.

fields.description: Please add configurable decimal places option to Insight's float data type to support showing money or cost data. Currently it only shows one decimal place by default if you put a whole or tenth number. We'd like to set it to round and cut off a certain number of decimal places and also add a *prefix* option for a dollar sign $.

fields.description: Cloud JIRA used to have markdown support for description and comments and that used to be very handy in adding code and other formatting. Would be great to have that on data server instances as well.
fields.summary: Add Markdown down support to Jira description and comment fields

fields.description:
Our documentation in [Changing JIRA Home Directory in jira-application.properties doesn't work|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/changing-jira-home-directory-in-jira-application-properties-doesn-t-work-665223951.html] indicates that the the order of JIRA home directory configurations according to priority is as follows:
# JIRA_HOME="/path/to/jira/home" (setenv.sh)
# JIRA_HOME="/path/to/jira/home" (configured in your operating system)
# <Parametername="jira.home"value="c:/jira/home"/> (server.xml)
# jira.home = /path/to/jira/home (jira-application.properties)

This is in conflict with the information provided in [Setting your Jira application home directory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver084/setting-your-jira-application-home-directory-979405297.html], where it states "We recommend setting Jira home through the JIRA_HOME environment variable, _because it takes precedence over any other method._"

This is a request to update the information in one or both places to be consistent and clear.
fields.summary: Priority of Jira Home Directory configurations

fields.description:
After upgrading to Jira 8.20.x, Customers are now getting the Instance health check warning, {*}Duplicate user accounts{*}.

Some accounts may be duplicated on purpose. For example, duplicate Jira System Administrator accounts may exist in the Jira internal user directory to maintain administrative access to Jira in case any of the external directories fail.

According to [Health check: Duplicate user accounts|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/health-check-duplicate-user-accounts-1063554355.html], it's possible to ignore some duplicates by listing the usernames under the {{jira.security.duplicated.user.accounts}} advanced setting.

However it's necessary to add all the users one by one which depending of the size of the instance, could take a great amount of efforts and time, and would also need to be updated every time a new user is added to the directories.

This feature request suggest Jira to have the ability to i{*}gnore duplicate entries{*} on specific directories, so the duplicated accounts error on the health check could be silenced.
fields.summary: Duplicate user accounts

fields.description:
When adding a link or an attachment it is not visible which comment has been used to create the link.

Reading the history (ALL) is not that user-friendly, it leads to everybody adding text like "linked to..." or "added attachment..." inside the comment, which is quite confusing.
It's often very helpful to see which attachment belongs to which comment and vice versa.
h4. Suggestions
 * Display the links/attachments added directly at the comment.
 * Display the comment directly at the link/attachment.
 * Allow jumping from a comment to a linked object and vice versa.
 * Creation of options like buttons, hoover, submenu, etc.
fields.summary: Display of link at the comment for a linked/attached object

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The installation type of a Data Center instance is shown as Standalone instead of Data Center

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Jira Data Center instance, navigate to Administration > System > System info.
 # Check the Installation type.

h3. Expected Results

h3. Actual Results

 !image-2021-12-16-11-41-02-109.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: System info showing Data Center instance as Standalone

fields.description:
We've made JIRA a central part of our infrastructure and the JIRA ID is used as a critical database key for many downstream operations. Therefore it's essential that our users be able to quickly and accurately enter it into fields of other tools. When the wrong value is used it causes painful and expensive problems. Unfortunately, users currently must either retype the ID manually or copy/paste it from within the URL in the browser address bar. Both of these are slow and error-prone. A Copy-ID-to-Clipboard button, which takes only a few lines of Javascript, would prevent a large number of errors which are expensive to fix. It would make JIRA work more productively within our organisation.

Currently there's no place on the screen with the issue number, where you can select and copy. Alternatively a quick link or a copy to Clipboard button would solve this problem and would presumably be helpful for many other JIRA customers too.

Something like this:
PROJ-111
fields.summary: Clipboard button for copying Issue ID

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

A message is shown in Manage apps, when disconnecting Marketplace.
There is a broken link in the message ([Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/app/jira/featured])

 

Seems [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/app/jira/featured] does not exist. It is doubted that it should be linked to below url.
 * Jira home: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/addons/app/jira/]

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # _JIRA ADMINISTRATION > Manage apps > Settings_
 # Uncheck [Connect to the Atlassian Marketplace] , and apply
 # Blow message is shown
{panel}
A system administrator has disabled your connection to the Atlassian Marketplace server. Re-enable the connection to receive information about important app updates. You can also search for new apps and updates on the [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/app/jira/featured?source=side_nav_manage_addons] website.
{panel}

 # if click  [Atlassian Marketplace|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/app/jira/featured?source=side_nav_manage_addons] 

h3. Expected Results

The page of the link is shown properly.

 
h3. Actual Results

Seems the link is to [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/app/jira/featured]

However, below error is shown in the page.
{code:java}
Looks like you took a wrong turn {code}
!marketplace_broken_link_1.png|thumbnail! !marketplace_broken_link_2.png|thumbnail!

 

Also, 404 error happened for below request, if using development tool
{noformat}
https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/app/jira/featured
Status Code: 404 
{noformat}
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.

The customer can access marketplace from the home: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/]
fields.summary: Broken link to marketplace in message when disconnecting  marketplace

fields.description:
My team would find it very useful to have a higher level ticket type be the parent of lower level types. For example, the following types should be able to be the parents of the ones below them:

*Initiative* (Parent)
 * Epic
 * Story
 * Bug
 * Task
 * Sub-Task

*Epic* (Parent)
 * Story
 * Bug
 * Task
 * Sub-Task

*Story* (Parent)
 * Bug
 * Task
 * Sub-Task

*Bug* (Parent)
 * Task
 * Sub-Task

*Task* (Parent)
 * Sub-Task

Thanks!

ian
fields.summary: Jira should allow tickets to be parented by a higher level ticket type

fields.description:
The Integrity Checker is a heavy job, both on heap, CPU, and database usage. When it's run simultaneously more than once in an instance, it can cause performance issues.

Please add a cluster lock on the Integrity Checker process, to prevent issues like these from happening.
fields.summary: Prevent Integrity Checker from running more than once at a time

fields.description: One of our users suggested that Atlassian consider allowing the user-defined personal settings ([https://jira.DOMAIN.com/secure/AccessibilityPersonalSettings!default.jspa)|https://jira.domain.com/secure/AccessibilityPersonalSettings!default.jspa)] to also apply to email notifications sent to that user.
fields.summary: Allow user preference settings to apply to email notifications

fields.description:
!image-2021-12-15-09-33-15-126.png!

When you receive dozens of emails like this every day, Jira becomes a very frustrating tool. Without viewing an alert in a preview pane, it's nearly impossible to know what the alert is about.

Is it possible Jira email alerts could be configured so the ‘from’ address (which is now ‘noreply’) was the card number and the subject line (which is now largely taken up by ‘[Central JIRA] Updates for…’) was instead just the name of the card?

After your first 10,000 Jira email alerts or so, it's pretty clear these are 'noreply' message.
fields.summary: Jira Email Alerts -

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When exporting issues for All fields using CSV or Excel it will display the wiki markup of the fields. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Add Wiki-mark up into fields such as Description
 # Export (All Fields) CSV and Excel 

h3. Actual Results

!image-2021-12-14-14-01-19-472.png!
h3. Suggestion

Have an option that would allow the wiki-style render to be removed or added into the CSV or Excel exports.
fields.summary: Option to display Wiki-Style Render in Excel/CSV exports

fields.description:
h3. Current behavior

The {{/rest/api/2/permissions}} endpoint can only be used to review permissions.

h3. Requested behavior

As a Jira Admin, I would like to set Global Permissions via the REST API in bulk.
fields.summary: Jira API for setting Global Permissions

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Custom Field Label does not show suggestions as expected when system label field  already has the given value that user is trying to use into the custom field label.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a custom field label type, in this case, we will name it as "Themes", add it to the issue screen
 !image001-1.png|thumbnail! 
# Create an issue (Test-10) and use the label field and themes with the same label name, such as test001
 !image002-1.png|thumbnail! 
# In another ticket (Test-14) add the label test001, it will be shown in the suggestions field.
 !image003.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
In issue Test-14 user should see suggestions from the custom field label (Themes) about test001

h3. Actual Results
When you reach the custom field label option (Themes), the test001 does not suggest the label test001, and it will appear as being a new label.
 !image004.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Custom Field Label does not show expected suggestion if system label field already has it.

fields.description:
h3. Definition:

When configuring the Kanban board or Sprint Scrum Board to use swimlanes and choosing the option to group the issues (sub-tasks) on the board by stories, the story for each swim lane is shown with a clickable link and its status.

However, when configuring the board to use swim lanes to group by epics, the epics are displayed without an Epic Link.

We understand that Epics behaves in a different way due to the fact there is a separate panel for Epics in the Scrum and Kanban Backlog board which can be enabled from {*}Board->Configuration-> Column Management-> Epic Panel{*}. 
h3. Suggestion:

Epic Link to be shown on the Kanban and Scrum Sprint Board when the swimlanes are configured to be grouped by "Epics".
fields.summary: Swim lanes by epics do not show links or statuses for the epics in the Agile Boards

fields.description:
As a Jira user would be nice to be able to view Html attachments in-line, instead of being necessary to download them. 
This implementation would facilitate user interaction with the attachments and spare a lot of time.
fields.summary: Ability to view html attachments in-line (instead of download)

fields.description:
Current JIRA auditing does not allow to trace license assignments to users, as such making it difficult to track when a user was granted a license and application access as a result.

It will be great to see additional events logged in JIRA audit, such as the very first time a user was granted a license to JIRA and subsequent first login by using that license.
fields.summary: Additional auditing for licensing related events

fields.description: Currently date / time pickers in Jira Server only have the option of free form time. Some users would like to be able to configure Jira to use 30 min time intervals, similar to what is available in Jira Cloud
fields.summary: Allow date / time pickers to use 15 or 30 min time intervals

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Selecting a user for assignee in basic mode, below error will occur in search screen.
{code}
The Jira server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.
{code}
This problem only happen *when current user does not have Browse Users global permission* .

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove [Browse Users] permission for a group
 # Login Jira with a user belong to the above group
 # Move to _Issues > Search for issues_
 # Click [Assignee], and enter a username.
 # A user will show up, click the checkbox for the user

h3. Expected Results

No error.
h3. Actual Results
Blow error is shown in the page
{noformat}
The Jira server could not be contacted. This may be a temporary glitch or the server may be down.
{noformat}
 !JRASERVER-73112-error.png|thumbnail! 
Also, 403 error happened in har file for below request.
{code}
http://11.22.3344:8080/secure/QueryComponentRendererValue!Default.jspa
{code}
 !JRASERVER-73112-403.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Error in selecting users for assignee when current user does not have Browse Users global permission

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It happens when the current user does not have [Browse Users] global permission.
In issue search, the selected users for assignee will be lost when shift from advanced mode to basic mode.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Remove [Browse Users] permission for a group
 # Login Jira with a user belong to the above group
 # Move to _Issues > Search for issues_
 # Click [Advanced] to go to advanced mode.
 # Input a JQL like below
{code:java}
assignee in (other_user_name)
{code}
 # After search result returned, go back to basic mode
 !advanced_mode.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Assignee will have user selected.

h3. Actual Results
Assignee loose the selection of  users.
 !basic_mode.png|thumbnail! 
h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior.
fields.summary: Assignee lose selected users when shift from advanced mode to basic mode
Jira assignable user doesn't appear if they are a member of a group with upper case Cyrillic characters

fields.description:
We are unable to work on Issue search or advanced filter screen due to its appearance or you can call it's a usability issue. As when we open up the screen and there is a search bar with a long query in the advanced query mode option I am unable to see the list of issues that belongs to that query due to its screen. Please add up the option to minimize the query bar or any other alternative to improve its visibility.

!image-2021-12-13-16-16-16-855.png|width=799,height=304!
fields.summary: Improve the usability by minimizing the search bar of advanced search page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to delete Project Role configuration after deleting group in Crowd. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Step 1: Configure User Directory with Crowd.
Step 2: Synchronise with Crowd, and create "groupfromcrowd" group from Crowd in Jira.
Step 3: Configure Project Role with "groupfromcrowd" group in Jira.
Step 4: Delete "groupfromcrowd" group in Crowd.
Step 5: Synchronise with Crowd in Jira.
Step 6: Delete Project Role configuration with "groupfromcrowd" group in Jira.
Step 7: Reload browser, but Project Role configuration with "groupfromcrowd" group is still remained.

 [^jira-delete-project_role-after-sync-and-crowd-group-deleted.mp4] 

h3. Expected Results

You can delete Project Role configuration.

h3. Actual Results

You can't delete Project role configuration.

h3. Workaround

You need to delete Project Role configuration first before Deleting Group in Crowd and Synchronise.
fields.summary: Unable to delete Project Role configuration after deleting group in Crowd.

	at java.base/java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:264)
	at com.atlassian.jira.task.ForkedThreadExecutor$ForkedRunnableDecorator.run(ForkedThreadExecutor.java:216)
	at java.base/java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:834)
{noformat}

h3. Notes

There is a new Created date field in JIRA Software Cloud, however it does not currently exist in JIRA Software Server. Due to this the project import will fail. This does *not* impact XML restores, only project import.

h3. Workaround

Remove the column from the step instance's database directly and create a new XML backup.
* Postgres:
{code:SQL}
ALTER TABLE "AO_60DB71_SPRINT"
  DROP COLUMN "CREATED_DATE";
{code}
* MySQL:
{code:SQL}
ALTER TABLE AO_60DB71_SPRINT
  DROP COLUMN CREATED_DATE;
{code}
fields.summary: Project Import fails due to SprintAO does not have field CREATED_DATE

fields.description:
There is no official documentation that explains the job scheduler error (Job runner key _____ is not registered) and its root cause.
 !Screenshot 2021-12-10 at 7.22.58 PM.png|thumbnail! 

 !Screenshot 2021-12-10 at 7.23.08 PM.png|thumbnail! 

Jira users find it difficult to identify the exact root cause. 
One common root cause: The application or plugin associated with the scheduler is no longer present in the system.
It will be helpful if we have official documentation that explains the possible causes and their resolutions.
fields.summary: Document how to handle the Error: Job runner key _____ is not registered, in Scheduler Administration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Validation of a custom field (That is marked as Required) shows a duplicate value that has "not available" displayed on the workflow transition screen in case the validation fails.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a custom field "Checkboxes (Choose multi values using checkboxes)". Add one value to the checkbox list.  
 # Set the custom field as required. And add it to any of the transition screens.
 # As it is a required field, the checkbox has to be checked while creating the issue.
 # Later while performing transition this field appears on the screen with the option checked.
 # Uncheck the field and proceed to submit.
 # The form would not be submitted (which is expected) but there is a duplicate value displayed on the screen of the checkbox with "not available" displayed at the end like below.

      *AffirmationRequired*
 * I Affirm this to be a valid request
 * I Affirm this to be a valid request (not available)

h3. Expected Results
The duplicate value or incorrect display should not appear on the screen. 
h3. Actual Results

A duplicate value with "not available" at the end is displayed on the screen.
h3. Workaround

This doesn't cause any functional impact. Users can still proceed to select one of the fields and proceed to form submission. But it is an incorrect screen display.
fields.summary: Validating a custom field (set to required) showing duplicate values

Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your input in the comments helps us understand how this affects you and what you're hoping to accomplish with JIRA.

This suggestion is a priority for the JIRA development team, but I am not able to provide an accurate estimate for when this will be resolved. We will update this issue as soon as we can confidently project a release.

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].

I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.

Regards,
Dave Meyer
[dmeyer@atlassian.com|mailto:dmeyer@atlassian.com]
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

A new file attachment should be also considered as notification event.

-- Arpad

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If a username contains a pipe character, such as {{google-apps|jbiden}}, user mention linking will not be activated - the user mention will be rendered as is, e.g. 

{noformat}
[~google-apps|jdbiden]
{noformat}

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a username with a pipe character, e.g. {{google-apps|jbiden}}
 # Try mentioning this user in a comment

h3. Expected Results

Jira resolves the username and replaces the pattern with a user profile link. User will get an email notification about them being mentioned.

h3. Actual Results

Mention pattern is rendered as is. No email notification about the user mention is sent.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Having pipe character in a username prevents user mentions linking

fields.description:
While working with a PowerShell script that automates our user management activities, we had the Jira Align connector account loose Jira license access which stopped the data sync between the tools. 

Unfortunately, we had to hear about it from the user community via an escalation. We determined the root cause after investigating our recent changes.

During post mortem we identified that the Jira Align activity logs are able to be filtered, but it does not have any filter subscription like Jira where we can set a schedule to receive the filter results that are looking for specific failures within the Activity Logs.

As a workaround, we have to manually periodically visit the filtered activity logs and monitor it to ensure we avoid any discrepancies or failures. We took this to our TAM and he recommended to submit this suggestion.

Thanks!

Luis Tellado
fields.summary: Jira Align | Filter Subscription | Change Activity Logs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

List of issues cannot be listed under Linked Issue under Board that are accessed via App link to another Jira instance 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Have Jira Server A and Jira Server B 
 # Create few issues in Jira Server B
 # Now Create a app link to Jira Server  B in Jira Server A
 # Attempt to create an issue in Jira Server A and link issues from Board
 # Select the Server in the Link Search Dialog and check the issues in the drop down

h3. Expected Results

The Issues from Jira Server B should be listed in the search Drop down when attempted to link issue from BOARD
h3. Actual Results

The Issues does not gets listed from Different Jira Server Instance via app link

Further inspecting the request, it seems even though the served for the App link is selected, it does not gets used in the request and queries its local Server instead, The same works from Issue Detail page under Issue Navigator.
h3. Workaround

You may link issues from Issue Navigator
fields.summary: Issues from another JIRA instance cannot be listed via app Link under Board

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Jira uses the {{atlassian.xsrf.token}} cookie to help preventing XSRF attacks -- see [Jira application cookies|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-application-cookies-938847892.html] and [Form token handling|https://developer.atlassian.com/server/jira/platform/form-token-handling/] for more details on this.

When running Jira Data Center with multiple nodes, users accessing Jira from a browser should stick to a specific node during the lifetime of their session -- see [Jira Data Center Load Balancer examples|https://confluence.atlassian.com/enterprise/jira-data-center-load-balancer-examples-781200827.html].

If the current node a user is accessing becomes offline (planned maintenance or a failure), then the load balancer is responsible to send subsequent requests to a different node.

Depending on what the user was doing on the browser, some requests may fail because of an XSRF token validation error as that token is known locally by a node and not shared.


Here's an example on how to recreate that situation:
{quote}
* Jira environment has two nodes: {{node1}} and {{node2}}.
* User is accessing Jira through {{node1}}.
 ** Remember me option was enabled when authenticating, making {{seraph.rememberme.cookie}} available for the user's session.
* {{node1}} is removed from the load balancer.
* When the user makes a _regular_ request (i.e. opens a Jira issue), then it is forwarded to {{node2}} and a new authentication is *not* required.
* Now the user is accessing Jira through {{node2}}.
* The user starts creating a new Jira issue.
* Before submitting, {{node1}} is up and running, and {{node2}} is removed from the load balancer.
* The user submits the new Jira issue through the form, which is forwarded to {{node1}}.
* This fails because of an XSRF token validation error.
 ** The user needs to create the issue again and the work is missed.
 ** This may occur on other user cases where a form is presented to the user.
{quote}


h3. Suggested Solution
It would be a good user experience if the _XSRF Security Token_ behave similar to the _remember my login_ [session cookie|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-application-cookies-938847892.html].
That way, when a node switchover occurs, the token sent from the client (browser) would be recognized by the application and proceed with the action.
fields.summary: As a Jira user I would like to have a more smooth experience related to the XSRF security token when switching from one Data Center node to another

fields.description:
h3. Problem

Creating an option list for a cascading field where a child has the value of its parent id causes the basic mode to use that id as a value in a search.
h3. Environment

Jira server 8.13.14
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create or select a custom field of type "Select List (Cascading)", out of the box *Operational categorization.*
 # In the database search for the id of the Parent for the options, for example:  "Server Change", id = 10076.
 # Now edit the options for Server Change and add a child with value 10076.
 # Run reindex
 # Go to search issues, select > more > Operational categorization with values;
 ** Parent: Server Change
 ** Child: 10076
 # Click update

h3. Expected Results

The search with the set values will be used to search issues.
h3. Actual Results

A message is shown that the search was invalid:

The option '10076' specified in function 'cascadeOption' is not a valid parent option.
h3. Workaround

Switch to advanced search or add a space character behind the child option value in the field configuration.
fields.summary: Creating an option list for a cascading field where a child has the value of its parent id causes the basic mode to use that value as an id in a search.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Table created from Outlook or Excel which Includes Colors and Style will mess up the table format when copied to Jira. Also, if the cell is empty or more cells are merged together the same format does not show up in Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a table with 5 rows and columns add colors and Styles to the cell that does not exist in Jira. Merge some cells and keep a cell empty.
 # Copy and paste this data to the Description in Jira description
 # This will change the format of the table as the color isn't available. This can be observed from the text editor.

h3. Expected Results

Use the same color, style, and cell format as originated from Outlook, Excel, or Word application
h3. Actual Results

Table format or style changes and makes it unreadable.
h3. Workaround

Use "clear format" from the "more" menu prior to setting up color or style from the Jira available options.
fields.summary: Table data in Jira Issue description is messed up when color is not available or the cell is empty/merged

fields.description:
Hi,

 

I do not know when this was introduced, but we recently updated our JSM DC to 8.13. and I found out that the "Users & Roles" view has been changed.

I find the view extremely confusing because one has no overview of users and roles anymore due to the fact that the "users & roles" view is now sorted by users and groups, which - for example in our support project - is now spread over 10 screens instead of 1 or 2 screens in the old view.

I don't know the reason behind this change, but it would be great to give Jira administrators the choice to switch back to the old view, where users and roles where sorted by project roles instead of users and groups.

 

Thanks and please upvote this if you're interested.
fields.summary: Bring back the "old" Users & Roles view in JSM

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

You can't set "-1" to the custom field "Text Field (single line)" and it will clear the value.
The same issue happens when setting the field value in the custom field "Text Field (multi-line)" with "-1"(without line break).

 [^jira-customfiled-minus_one.mp4] 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
Step 1: Configure the custom field with "Text Field (single line)"
Step 2: Set "-1" to the field value.
Step 3: The field value will be cleared, and the value isn't "-1".

h3. Expected Results

You can set "-1" to the custom field("Text Field (single line)")

h3. Actual Results

You can't set "-1" to the custom field("Text Field (single line)"), and the field value is cleared.

h3. Workaround

Use different custom field type "Number Field" instead of "Text Field (single line)" or "Text Field (multi-line)".
fields.summary: Can't set "-1" to custom field "Text Field (single line)" and it will clear the field value.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Unable to update/change the *Start Date* and *Release Date* of a version from the *version panel* of the Jira Scrum board.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an existing scrum board project or create a new one.
 # Go to *Board* > *Show version panel*
 # Create a new version or select any existing version
 # Try to update or change the *Start date* or *Release date*

h3. Expected Results

You can update/change the Start date and Release date of versions from the version panel of boards.
h3. Actual Results

Unable to edit the date field, as the field disappears on editing. Please find the attached video snippet for more clarity.
h3. Workaround
 * Access *Board* > *Releases* > _Select the version which you wish to update_ > *Actions* -Choose *Edit* .
 * Update the dates and click on {*}Save{*}.
 * Updated dates will show up in the version panel.
fields.summary: Unable to update Start Date and Release Date of a version from the version panel

However, the access logs include additional information on the requests being received by Jira, it would be a great improvement if that information was readily available in the administrative panel.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira session timeouts can be modified according to [Change the default session timeout to avoid user logout in Jira server|https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirakb/change-the-default-session-timeout-to-avoid-user-logout-in-jira-server-604209887.html]. However, this configuration is not respected while accessing dashboards configured with gadgets.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Modify the session timeout
 # Test the new session timeout on a dashboard with gadgets

h3. Expected Results

The configured session timeout will be respected.
h3. Actual Results

The session timeout is not respected and the session cookie will continue to refresh. The behavior is not currently outlined in [Jira Application Cookies|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-application-cookies-938847892.html].

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Document how session timeout works on dashboards

fields.description:
h3. (i) This issue affects Jira Server and single-node Jira DC only

See "Workaround" for more details.
h3. Issue Summary

{{DefaultServerIndexRepairService}} periodically queries the version tables to get all the issues updated in the past 25s. On Oracle DB this "25s" argument is passed as {{TIMESTAMP}} datatype, while {{update_time}} column has datatype {{{}DATE{}}}. This mismatch causes the DB to perform a full table scan. This causes unnecessary DB load.

The same issue applies to the three versioning tables: {{{}ISSUE_VERSION{}}}, {{COMMENT_VERSION}} and {{{}WORKLOG_VERSION{}}}.

The query run is
{code:sql}
select 
    ISSUE_VERSION.issue_id, 
    ISSUE_VERSION.parent_issue_id,
    ISSUE_VERSION.update_time,
    ISSUE_VERSION.index_version,
    ISSUE_VERSION.deleted
from issue_version ISSUE_VERSION
where ISSUE_VERSION.update_time > current_timestamp + interval '-25' second
{code}
The corresponding Java code is {{{}com.atlassian.jira.versioning.VersioningDao#findVersionsUpdatedInTheLast{}}}:
{code:java}
                        .where(updateTimePath.after(
                                SQLExpressions.addSeconds(
                                        DateTimeExpression.currentTimestamp(Timestamp.class),
                                        (int) -duration.getSeconds()))){code}
Potentially (not tested!) changing this to
{code:java}
DateTimeExpression.currentDate(Timestamp.class){code}
would solve the problem, but the impact on DBs from other vendors would need to be checked.

This was reproduced on Oracle DB. At this moment we don't know if other DB types are affected by this issue.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Run Jira Server on Oracle DB.
 # {{DefaultServerIndexRepairService}} will query the DB inefficiently

h3. Expected Results

{{iv_update_time}} / {{cv_update_time}} / {{wv_update_time}} indexes are used.
h3. Actual Results

Full table scan is performed.
h3. Impact

The query is inefficient, but does not impact Jira nor the DB significantly.
h3. Workaround

This issue affects Jira Server and [Jira single-node DC|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/running-jira-data-center-on-a-single-node-993929595.html] only. In order to avoid this issue, migrate to Jira DC cluster following [this guide|https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/set-up-a-jira-data-center-cluster-993929600.html]. Mind you, you do _not_ need to set up a second node. It's enough to set up the shared home and {{cluster.properties}} file.
fields.summary: issue/comment/worklog version tables are searched without using the DB index

fields.description:
Hello,

In our company we were using the plugin "Quick Subtasks for Jira" (see link below) in our Jira server. But now we switched to Datacenter and this plugin is not available anymore, and it is not planned to be updated and approved for the Datacenter.

So we have to use post functions instead, which are not as powerful as this plugin, that is really helpful to create several subtasks, based on a template, containing prefilled values from parent task fields (even custom fields) or other predefined values.

Could you implement this plugin as a native feature of Jira? 

Thanks,

Best Regards

 

Link to "Quick Subtasks for JIRA" plugin:

[https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1210972/quick-subtasks-for-jira?tab=reviews&hosting=server]
fields.summary: Add feature "Create multiple subtasks" with inherited parent fields

fields.description:
Affected versions of Atlassian Jira Server and Data Center allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTML or JavaScript via a Reflected Cross-Site Scripting (XSS) vulnerability in the /rest/collectors/1.0/template/custom endpoint. To exploit this issue, the attacker must trick a user into visiting a malicious website.

The affected versions are before version 8.13.15, and from version 8.14.0 before 8.20.3.

*Affected versions:*

 * version < 8.13.15
 * 8.14.0 ≤ version < 8.20.3

*Fixed versions:*

 * 8.13.15
 * 8.20.3
 * 8.21.0
fields.summary: Reflected XSS via /rest/collectors/1.0/template/custom - CVE-2021-43942

h4. Problem Definition
Currently, it is not possible to create a Workflow condition/validator based on a JQL search

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. But, you can use some *3rd party* plugins, such as:

fields.summary: Add JQL search as Workflow condition/validator

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a project key is archived, the mail handler edit UI breaks after we click the first *Next* button - the edit screen vanishes.
 !image-2021-11-30-13-12-57-703.png|thumbnail! 

We can see in a HAR file that Jira sends to the UI the configured project key and a list of the available project keys - the archived project doesn't show up, breaking the UI.

It would probably make sense to just delete the mail handler when archiving a project or display a warning for the archived project in the Incoming Mail screen.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project
 # Create a mail handler and associate with the project
 # Archive the project
 # Attempt to edit the mail handler

h3. Expected Results

It works normally.
h3. Actual Results

The UI disappears after clicking the Next button.

No errors are visible, as the error happens in the UI.
h3. Workaround

Delete the mail handler, as it doesn't make sense to exist anymore.
fields.summary: Mail handler edit UI breaks when the project is archived

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When a project key is renamed, the mail handler edit UI breaks after we click the first *Next* button - the edit screen vanishes.
!image-2021-11-30-12-47-36-279.png|width=443,height=252!

We can see in a HAR file that Jira sends to the UI the configured (old) project key and a list of the available project keys.

Apparently, it doesn't check for old project keys, and when trying to match the one configured in the DB with the ones available, it breaks.

Also, Jira doesn't check the mail handler configs to update them on a project key change.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project
 # Create a mail handler and associate with the project
 # Change the project key
 # Attempt to edit the mail handler

h3. Expected Results

It works normally.
h3. Actual Results

The UI disappears after clicking the Next button.

No errors are visible, as the error happens in the UI.
h3. Workaround

There are 2 possible solutions:
 * Delete the mail handler and recreate it;
(i) Tip: the {{SELECT}} query below gets the mail handler configurations. It might come in handy if/when recreating it.
 * Or update the configs in the database directly:
(!) Before starting, take a database backup and perform the procedure in staging first.
 ** First identify the entry we need to update:
{code:sql}
SELECT *
FROM propertystring
WHERE 
id IN (SELECT id FROM propertyentry WHERE property_key LIKE '%handler%')
AND propertyvalue LIKE '%KEY%';
{code}
(i) Replace *KEY* in the {{WHERE}} clause for the old project key. If in doubt, remove the last line in the query to retrieve all mail handlers.
 * Take note of the ID and copy the {{propertyvalue}} we wish to change.
 * Update the desired entry:
{code:sql}
UPDATE propertystring
SET propertyvalue = '<edited_config>'
WHERE id = <id_from_query_above>
{code}
 * Restart Jira
fields.summary: Mail handler edit UI breaks when project key is renamed

fields.description:
At the moment, it is not possible to sort the "mentioned in" Confluence Page link inside the Jira Issue to order by Title/Date etc. This because, Jira pulled the information from Confluence by sending the XML HTTP request to Confluence and display the information based on the response content from Confluence.

For a Jira Issue that is link to many Confluence Pages, it'd be beneficial to have the functionality to sort the order of Confluence Page link "mentioned in" the Jira Issue which would be easier for the users to find for the desired Confluence Page Link.
fields.summary: Ability to sort the order of Confluence Page "mentioned in" in Jira Issue view.

fields.description:
The current description for the "{*}Don't notify me{*}" button in Customer Portal ({*}Keine Benachrichtigungen{*}) seems to be misleading, as the user does not know whether this indicates the current state of the ticket (state: no notifications) or if the button needs to be clicked in order to not receive any notifications (action required to not receive notifications). This is causing users to opt out notifications incorrectly.

A better translation for this would be the following:

Don't notify me - *Keine Benachrichtigungen erhalten*

Get notifications - *Benachrichtigungen erhalten*
fields.summary: Confusing translation for "Don't notify me" to German

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

JQL Search results using sprint name are incorrect for a Non-Admin user when the user doesn't have access to the board or when it cannot be checked if the user has access to the board (Example: board associated with sprint was deleted)
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Scrum Software Project "Test Sprint" with scrum board "TS board"
 # Create 20 issues in the backlog on the board.
 # Create a Sprint with the name ISRA42 on the board and move 5-6 issues in this sprint.
 # Now create two more sprints with name "SAS ServiceOps Bugs", "SAS Support Bugs" on the same board and move remaining issues in these sprints
 # Go to the User Management section and create a group "ABCD"
 # Create two users sp1 and sp2 with jira-software-users groups so they can access Jira.
 # Now, also Add group ABCD to the User sp2
 # Go back to the board "TS board" and configure it to share the associated Filter view permission with the only group "ABCD" 
 # Next, start the sprint ISRA42, close some of the issues under it and complete this sprint.
 # Now, run the below JQL search with user sp1, sp2, and one of the global admin users. 
{code:java}
sprint in ("SAS ServiceOps Bugs", "SAS Support Bugs"){code}

h3. Expected Results

All three users should be able to see issues under these sprints.
h3. Actual Results

Global Admin and user sp2 see the correct results while the user sp1 sees incorrect results and even gets issues of the sprint ISRA42 in the JQL search result.
Below is the search result for user sp1
!Screenshot 2021-11-29 at 9.20.28 PM.png|thumbnail!

{*}Note{*}: If we delete the board "TS Board", then even user sp2 having access to group ABCD will start getting incorrect results as it cannot be determined now, if the user has access to the board's filter Global admin can still see the correct results.
h3. Workaround

Run the JQL search using sprint ID.

Check the sprint ID from the table AO_60DB71_SPRINT
{code:java}
jira8139=# select "ID","NAME" from "AO_60DB71_SPRINT" ;
 ID |        NAME         
----+---------------------
  2 | SAS ServiceOps Bugs
  3 | SAS Support Bugs
  1 | ISRA42
(3 rows) {code}
and run the JQL search using it
{code:java}
sprint in (2,3) {code}
fields.summary: JQL Search results using sprint name are incorrect for a Non-Admin user when the user doesn't have access to the board or when it cannot be checked if user has access to the board

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Unauthorized access to data from the following API even if the *public.access.disabled* is enabled.
/rest/api/2/projectCategory
/rest/api/2/resolution
/rest/menu/latest/admin

h3. Steps to Reproduce
- Install Jira 8.13.9 with H2 database
- Create a project and some Project categories
- Run the API call "http://localhost:48139/j8139/rest/api/2/projectCategory" without the username and password.

h3. Expected Results
- Unauthorised access and the data should not be visible.

h3. Actual Results
- Project categories, resolutions, and usernames are listed even if the API is not authenticated

h3. Workaround
Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Information Disclosure ever after CVE-2020-14179/JRASERVER-71536

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

API changelog is linked to the wrong version (8.13) on the [8.20 Release Notes page |https://confluence.atlassian.com/jirasoftware/jira-software-8-20-x-release-notes-1086411771.html#JiraSoftware8.20.xreleasenotes-api]
fields.summary: API Change Log is missing for 8.20

fields.description:
The customer is using Oracle DB in production environment. They encountered a problem that Undo space in almost full.

It is identified that the deletion of AO_733371_EVENT_PARAMETER caused this problem.
{code:java}
SQL_ID：7z8pmm0qmhmhf
delete from "AO_733371_EVENT_PARAMETER" where "AO_733371_EVENT_PARAMETER"."EVENT_ID" in (select "AO_733371_EVENT"."ID" from "AO_733371_EVENT" "AO_733371_EVENT" where "AO_733371_EVENT"."CREATED" <= :1 )
{code}
It should be due to  too much data written to AO_733371_EVENT_PARAMETER table.

In order to avoid the impact to undo space, *the customer wish we can reduce the writing to AO_733371_EVENT_PARAMETER.* 

 
h3. Note

One cause is  below existing issue. Seems the table keeps growing bigger, though batched mail is disabled as mentioned.
 * JSWSERVER-20794: Disable populating the database table AO_733371_EVENT_PARAMETER table when Batching feature is disabled

It is better to check any other cause which contribute to too much data in AO_733371_EVENT_PARAMETER.
fields.summary: Huge data in AO_733371_EVENT_PARAMETER  has impact on undo space of Oracle DB

fields.description:
Hi, I'm Gunwoo Park.

I have a user pool and want to let my users to log into JSD through my user pool. There is no "email" information in my user pool, so I'd like to use "sub" for Open ID Connect.

I need to create a corresponding JSD user programmatically for each user and I've checked JSD REST API and found POST /rest/servicedeskapi/customer.

There is a problem with the mentioned endpoint, which is I cannot set "username" as whatever I want. The JSD REST API document says "The customer's username is their email address", which is obviously a different behavior with JSD Admin Webpage where I can set "username" as whatever I want.

This prevents me from assigning "sub" as "username" since the endpoint requires me to insert a valid email address, which cannot cover the sub format like 00567bd3-afe3-4eac-b123-b9e49aa1aca0.

I suggest you to consider adding a new input paremeter "username" on POST /rest/servicedeskapi/customer, which will allows me to create JSD users with sub as username.

I'll be looking forward to hearing from you. Thank you.
fields.summary: How to Set Custom Username When Creating Users Through JSD REST API

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When adding multiple mail handers in Jira, for the same project - you cannot change the order or priority in which they are processed.
h3. Why this is important

Some users have custom scripts or certain actions that need to be processed before other actions. Being able to configure the order is important for this.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to change ordering of mail handlers

fields.description: Current Jira does not have a way of natively limit the number of sessions that users are allowed to create. Considering a security standpoint, it would be great if Jira System Administrators were able to use a feature in the application to limit these sessions.
fields.summary: Allow administrators to limit the number of concurrent user sessions

fields.description:
Jira Admins have been using our statistics to capture potential problematic JQL:
 * Jira DC monitoring
 * Jira Slow logs
 * Jira Diagnostic logs

On these diagnostics, what does the "numberOfResults=-1" mean?

Please add the meaning of "numberOfResults=-1" on our [https://confluence.atlassian.com/adminjiraserver/jira-data-center-monitoring-976770793.html] documentation
fields.summary: On the Jira DC diagnostics logs, what is the meaning of numberOfResults -1?

fields.description:
Users can create filters and use them for
 * Gadgets,
 * Boards,
 * Webhooks,
 * Automations, 
 * and so on

A complex JQL with slow execution will be triggered on Jira DC monitoring, Slow query log and diagnostic log, but on none of them is possible to identify the filter used that caused the slow JQL execution.

The ideal would be to log when a filter used caused a slow query, logging the event. 
This event could be captured by a monitoring tool and the Jira Admin would be able to take an action, identifying the filter and the user who had created it.
fields.summary: As a Jira Admin I would like to be able to identify filters causing slow JQL

fields.description:
I saw already some post that Atlassian decide not to hide the report menu in Jira.

I am asking if there is ways to :
 # Restrict the authorizations for creating reports; i.e. only certain users (e.g. administrators) should be allowed to create reports.
 # Is it possible to generally exclude or deactivate the creation of reports within a project?
fields.summary: Hide Report menu for certain user in Jira
